pageContext.claim: “Now that wasn't very nice, was it? [quoting a tweet that reads, 'John McCain tried to destroy @realDonaldTrump with false accusations of treason by spreading the garbage Clinton- DNC Dossier.']”
pageContext.analysis: McCain only learned of the existence of the dossier at a conference in Halifax, Canada on Nov. 18 -- after the election -- from Andrew Wood, who had seen the documents written by Christopher Steele, a former British spy. McCain then in late November dispatched David J. Kramer, a senior director of the McCain Institute, to London to meet with Steele. Kramer returned to the U.S. with a copy of the dossier and gave it to McCain, who then gave it to the FBI. (The FBI already had a copy.)
